title: Week 2: January 5–11 - Moses 1; Abraham 3
content:
# Primary Lesson Plan: Week 2 (January 5–11) - I Am a Child of God (Moses 1; Abraham 3)

## Lesson Overview
This lesson helps 8-10-year-olds discover they are children of God with a divine destiny, as taught in Moses 1:4 and Abraham 3:22–28. Children learn Heavenly Father knows them, has work for them, and helps them resist Satan (Moses 1:12–26). Knowing their true identity builds confidence to choose right daily, like Moses did.

## TEACHER LESSON (8-10 minutes)
**Hook (1-2 minutes):** Hold up a mirror and ask, "Who do you see? Heavenly Father sees you as His child with important work to do!" (Moses 1:4, 6).

**Scripture Story (3-4 minutes):** Tell how Moses saw God, who said, "Thou art my son" (Moses 1:4, 6). Satan tempted Moses to worship him (Moses 1:12), but Moses said, "Get thee hence, Satan" and called on God (Moses 1:13–26). God helped Moses see his divine worth. Ask: "How did Moses feel when God called him His son? What did Moses do when Satan came?"

**Gospel Principle (2-3 minutes):** We are children of God who lived as spirits "before the world was" (Abraham 3:22–28). Heavenly Father sent us to earth to "prove" ourselves by choosing good (Abraham 3:25). Satan tries to confuse us, but God helps us resist, like Moses.

**Application (1-2 minutes):** At home, say "I am a child of God" in the mirror. At school, choose to be kind because you have divine worth.

## Opening Activity (5 minutes) - Object Lesson
**Materials:** Small mirror.  
Pass the mirror; each child looks and repeats: "I am a child of God" (Moses 1:4). Discuss: Why are we glad Heavenly Father sees us this way? Connects to divine identity.

## Scripture Focus
- **Moses 1:4** (full verse): "And thou art my son; wherefore look and I will show thee the workmanship of mine hands..." *Child-friendly:* God told Moses, "You are my child! Look at all I created for you."
- **Abraham 3:23** (simplified from bundle): "In the midst... intelligences that were organized before the world was; and among all these, here are many that are noble and great." *Child-friendly:* We were spirits with Heavenly Father before earth; He has work for us here.

## Interactive Activities (15-20 minutes total)
### 1. Mirror Message Relay (Physical Activity, 5 minutes)
**Materials:** None.  
**Steps:** Children stand in lines. Teacher says God's message: "You are my child" (Moses 1:4). First child pretends to look in mirror, says it loud, runs to tag next. Switch to Satan's lie (Moses 1:12: "Moses, son of man, worship me")—they sit down instead.  
**Connection:** Shows choosing God's truth over Satan's, like Moses (Moses 1:12–26).  
**Questions:** "How did Moses feel saying no? What helps you say no to bad choices?"

### 2. Resist Satan Charades (Role-Play & Acting, 5-7 minutes)
**Materials:** Simple props (paper "Satan" mask, toy sword for "armor of God").  
**Steps:** Divide into pairs/small groups. Act out temptations (e.g., "lie to a friend," "watch bad show"). One is Satan tempting; other is child of God resisting like Moses: pray, say "Get thee hence," call for help (Moses 1:20–22, 26). Switch roles; perform for class.  
**Connection:** Moses resisted by remembering he was God's son (Moses 1:13, 15, 18).  
**Questions:** "What did Moses do to win? (Prayed, remembered God's power—Moses 1:24–26). How can Jesus help us?"

### 3. Premortal Spirit Drawings (Creative Expression, 5-7 minutes)
**Materials:** Paper, crayons.  
**Steps:** Children draw themselves as a spirit "before the world was" (Abraham 3:22), with Heavenly Father, Jesus, and earth mission (Abraham 3:24–26). Add "I will prove myself by..." (e.g., being kind). Share one drawing.  
**Connection:** We chose to come to earth for God's work (Abraham 3:25–28).  
**Questions:** "What work does God have for you? How does knowing you are His child change choices?"

## Testimony Time (3 minutes)
Invite quietly: "What do you feel when you know you are a child of God?" (Moses 1:4). Share if comfortable. Teacher: "I know Heavenly Father loves each of you and helps you, as He did Moses."

## Take-Home Challenge
Look in a mirror daily and say, "I am a child of God" (Moses 1:4). Tell one family member why it matters.

## Teacher Tips
- For wiggly kids, add claps/stomps during relays. Adapt for shy ones by pairing or drawing first. Time activities strictly to fit 30-40 minutes total. Use Gospel Art Book images of Moses for visuals (nos. 13–16).
